name: Milford Sound
fun_fact: Fun fact: Milford Sound is technically a fiord, not a sound (carved by glaciers, not rivers). Rudyard Kipling called it the 'eighth wonder of the world,' and it receives about 7 meters (23 feet) of rain annually - creating hundreds of temporary waterfalls!

hero_dishes.name: Blue Cod
hero_dishes.description: Delicate white fish caught in Fiordland waters, pan-fried with butter and lemon
hero_dishes.origin_story: The pristine waters of Fiordland produce exceptional seafood - blue cod is New Zealand's most prized eating fish
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Milford Sound Lodge, cruise boats serve fresh catch, Te Anau restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Crayfish (NZ Rock Lobster)
hero_dishes.description: Sweet, succulent lobster from cold Fiordland waters - often simply grilled with garlic butter
hero_dishes.origin_story: Fiordland crayfish are renowned - the cold, clean waters produce incredible flavor
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Te Anau restaurants, some cruise operators, Bluff to the south

hero_dishes.name: Venison
hero_dishes.description: Farm-raised New Zealand deer, lean and flavorful, often served with berry sauces
hero_dishes.origin_story: Red deer were introduced for hunting and are now farmed - Fiordland region specializes in wild game
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Redcliff Restaurant (Te Anau), Fat Duck (Te Anau), high-end NZ restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Meat Pie
hero_dishes.description: Classic NZ comfort food - flaky pastry filled with savory meat and gravy
hero_dishes.origin_story: A New Zealand institution - every roadside shop and bakery has their version
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Miles Better Pies (Te Anau), any NZ bakery

signature_drinks.name: Central Otago Pinot Noir
signature_drinks.description: World-class Pinot Noir from nearby Central Otago - the world's southernmost wine region
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: With lamb or venison - these wines rival Burgundy

signature_drinks.name: Flat White
signature_drinks.description: Espresso with microfoam milk - invented in Australia/NZ (they argue about it)

food_culture_notes: Te Anau (gateway town) has all dining options - Milford itself is remote
Pack a lunch for Milford day trips - limited food options on-site
Cruise boats sometimes offer fresh-caught seafood
Food in this region is simple but exceptionally fresh and high quality
